TopicTitle: Can make a launch stabaliser go in air

Articles.Content:

Edited August 28, 2014 by Claw

While amusing, it would be nice if you could supply a bit more information (assuming you're actually trying to report a bug of some sort).

Try checking this: http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/3610-Bug-Reporting-Guidelines-Bug-Tracker

(Also, I embedded your pic.)

Cheers,

~Claw

I don't know if this is a error.

Normally the clamps are attach to the rockets (I think) and if you don't release them they will goo after the rockets.

Regards

http://i.imgur.com/xA8E5xA.png

Well I know that I won't need to cancel some contracts now.

Did you just "rip them out"? How much force do you need for that?

Did you just "rip them out"? How much force do you need for that?

I used 9 mainsails I was trying to test my rocket but didn't want it to go up just needed to know if it would break apart if not moving like previous versions.

This is kinda like a bug but not really just wanted to show you don't need to cancel those contracts.

Are you using any mods?

When I took the screenshot I was using kerbal engineer and kerbal alarm clock but that's it.

No cheats
